awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: RUI: Factorization of Modular        Invariants and Heights of Heegner Points
awd_abstract_narration: This research will focus on two problems in algebraic                      geometry.  The first is to produce a factorization of a certain                 invariant associated to a particular algebraic curve called the                 classical modular curve of level N where N is a positive integer.               The second problem is the computation of the heights special                    points, called Heegner points, on Drinfeld modular curves.  This                investigation will entail the study of the endomorphism rings of                rank 2 Drinfeld modules having supersingular reduction and orders               in definite quaternion algebras.                                                     This project is in the general area of algebraic geometry.                 Algebraic geometry concerns the study of the curves and surfaces                that arise naturally as the sets of solutions of one or more                    algebraic equations.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
